reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2025

reviewDescription: These mini fuse beads have been such a hit in our household! My kids can spend hours creating designs, and I love that it keeps them busy while boosting their creativity and fine motor skills. The beads melt evenly when ironed, and the colors are bright and vibrant—perfect for making everything from simple patterns to more detailed projects. The size is just right for older kids who have the patience to work with smaller pieces (younger ones may need help). We also found it helpful to organize the beads into small containers so it’s easier to find the colors they want. What I love most is how proud my kids feel showing off their finished creations. It’s not just a craft—it’s a confidence builder too. Pros: • Bright, vibrant colors • Great for creativity and focus • Hours of screen-free fun • Finished projects look awesome Cons: • Small size makes them tricky for younger kids (but great for older kids!) Overall, highly recommend if you’re looking for a fun, affordable, and creative activity for kids.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2025

reviewTitle: Great variety and great price for beginners!
reviewDescription: The variety is amazing, and the colors are so vibrant and have a good selection for a beginner or an intermediate looking to get more into the hobby! The beads are very durable on their own, but also after being ironed, they stick together and are tough to break which is perfect for making fun keychains and wall decor! I can definitely recommend this as a fun gift for creative kids and teens and even adults in your life as they're incredibly easy to learn how to use, and all you have to do is have a hand iron to finish them up! Makes a great gift for the holidays, the bead container is durable and can be reused if you buy more beads to replace the used up ones! The kit comes with ample materials to start, and the 4 square bead plates can interlock to form 1 larger square plate for bigger projects!

reviewTitle: Peg boards WILL warp if you're not careful!
reviewDescription: While I do love it, the beads can tend to melt unevenly. Either too quick or too slow to melt. I feel like there's too many shades of blue and not enough of others. I find myself particularly in more need of grays, white and black (Although this came with extra baggies of white and black which I appreciate!) warmer shades, and skin tones. Do NOT use the iron to melt the beads while it's still on the pegboard!! Even with my small crafting iron and short melting time, half of my boards have warped and are unusable.

reviewDescription: I have been using fuse beads for a while, and I’ve never experienced anything like this. They melt way too easily and get stuck to the peg board. Seriously never seen this. I iron the same amount of time I normally would, I actually did less time on the one I just made and it over melted. Every bead over-melts almost instantly and I can’t find the damn sweet spot of time to even use the damn beads. I’ve had to throw away 3 pairs because they were garbage. Every single time they over melted. I make earrings, I don’t have a lot of money, and it makes me sad that these are so garbage. Literally adhered to the peg board I cannot remove it. I’m pissed off. I promise I know how to use fuse beads. I’ve made over 100 pairs successfully with other brands. I got these for the amount of colors and the array of colors, but I’ve clearly made a mistake and will stick with the brands I’ve used before. Great color selection but just, no.

reviewTitle: Terrible quality beads, actual garbage product
reviewDescription: This kit is garbage and I regret buying it at all. First of all, these are much smaller than typical perler / fuse beads. Which is fine, however, upon ironing my finished beads according to the directions (recommended 1-2 minutes) it completely melted the beads into LIQUID and the board is deformed as well. It’s cheap garbage. Neither the beads nor the pegboard can withstand the heat to properly fuse them together. Not to mention the “ironing paper” they give you is A PIECE OF PLASTIC THAT MELTS ONCE IT MAKES CONTACT WITH THE IRON. It’s literally just PLASTIC. Thank god I didn’t use it and ruin my iron, but seriously, what the hell is wrong with the people who made this? I have a lot of experience with fuse beads, but this is a scam. Don’t waste your money on this brand/seller, go buy from a reliable source. The fact that after ONE small use and ironing for less than an entire minute ruined my project AND the pegboard is unacceptable and ridiculous. I cannot recommend this at all.

reviewDescription: This kit was great and comes with so much stuff in it and was a great value for what i paid for it. I noticed the fuse beads in this kit are smaller then ones I have seen before,which is why I put 4 stars instead of 5, so I am curious what the difference will be in the end result. There are so many different colors in this kit with lots of fuse beads of each color. It also comes with several different patterns of all types of subjects you can follow, several clear pads to put the beads on to make whatever your making. There are some different papers to put on the project so you can iron it and the clear ones will make the project more clear and smooth and then a peice of some paper similar to baking paper that will make the project surface be a little more cloudy. This kit also comes with 2 pairs of different tweezers and some key chain rings to put your project on. This kit looks like anyone would have a blast and be able to show their creativity in their projects. My 10 yr old is very artistic and he will have a blast with this and it was one of the bigger hits for his christmas gifts. Definitely worth the buy.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2024

reviewDescription: Used this today after receiving as a Christmas gift. Really fun craft kit to use, comes with lots of stuff. I was only able to finish half of the butterfly 🦋 pattern i started today. I will already have to order more black beads to finish. My only complaint is that it should come with more black. Either a bigger section in the case or a refill bag. Unfortunately a refill bag of just black isn't available through inscraft so I'll have to order from another seller/brand. I do feel it's odd to not provide a sufficient amount of beads (in any color) required for a provided pattern. That is my only complaint, otherwise I enjoyed using this set today. As far as melting, I used a mini heat press. I read it was better for even heat distribution. I do believe the shrivelling is related to lingering on an area longer than others.

reviewTitle: Amazing mini beads for making things you can actually USE!
reviewDescription: Awesome MINI version of perler beads! Don’t expect to be able to be able to pick these things up with your fingers- it comes with a tweezers, which you’ll definitely want to use. This kit is not great for little kids. What makes these beads so awesome, is that you can create things you can actually do something with. You can make perler bead designs at a size that are ideal for keychains, jewelry, or patches. And you can make larger designs with amazing detail. The other thing I love is that the designs come out flexible and much less apt to break than perler bead designs. Tips: 1. Make sure you’re not going to get bumped AT ALL while you’re putting your design together. I sat on the couch while making this dragon, and when my dog jumped up with a deafening bark, I pretty much had to start over. 2. Use a med-low iron setting. 3. Be patient after you’re finished ironing. I tried to pull the plastic sheet off before my little bird design had cooled, and some of the melty beads stuck to the sheet. If that happens, it’s fine. Just put the sheet back down and go over it a bit with the iron again. And then wait till it cools. 4. If your design is stuck to the tray when you go to pull it off, use the tweezers to pull up the edges until you have enough up to grab hold. 5. To use a design as a patch to sew onto a bag or something, use a needle to make/enlarge the holes in all the edge beads (after it’s ironed and off the tray). Then use those holes to sew the design onto your bag, etc.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2025

reviewDescription: This is a great buy, good quality, would recommend.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2024

reviewTitle: Beads are different material from brand name Perler Beads
reviewDescription: These beads are almost sticky or tacky, not smooth like Perler beads usually are. I spent 20+ hours putting together a complex piece and ruined it while applying the iron because the pieces stuck to the parchment paper. Would not recommend.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024

reviewDescription: I bought this item because my granddaughter kept asking for it and it was great she keeps herself busy and loves it I recommend it.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2024

reviewDescription: I've noticed that sometimes the beads like to melt kinda funky. I'm used to the perler brand (they are compatible with them) and how they melt. These ones spread out more under the heat. I've also noticed that the tape method for ironing makes the adhesive from the painters tape to stick to one side of the bead project. Other than that, colors are pretty and the selection is nice for this pack. The shiny sheets are fun to play with and I'm enjoying the precise tweezers and giant mini pegboards.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2024

reviewDescription: I accidentally bought these thinking they were larger - but I’m absolutely in love with them! I prefer these to the larger beads, cause they’re so tiny and cute and can make much smaller things. They’re thin enough that I’ve been making bookmarks, and I’ve also been putting magnets on the backs of other ones I’ve made, which look cute on the fridge. Love it!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2024

reviewDescription: One of the boxes did come opened. So there was one box of colors that were already split everywhere inside before I unwrap the plastic.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2024

reviewDescription: Box was damaged and colors didn't melt or fuse together right I'm not sure what caused my colors to burst but that's my only issue so far.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024

reviewTitle: It’s okay for the variety, but has a lot of issues.
reviewDescription: First, the kit does not include instructions. Heat settings, patterns, anything. The perler beads melt inconsistently and stick to the board upon removal. The boards themselves when attached to each other, do not stay together at all… I had to restart sections several times because of that issue. The most subtle movement could ruin half of your piece and thus having to restart. The pegs themselves could be more stable.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024

reviewTitle: Good Adult or Older Kid Fuse Beads
reviewDescription: This kit comes with everything you need (except the iron, not surprisingly) to create some fun fuse bead creations. The beads are very tiny, but are great for making more detailed designs than you can make with the larger beads. Definitely more for adults and older kids though as little kids may struggle with the small beads. This kit comes with a great variety of colors which are already sorted in storage containers. The included tweezers are also very helpful with handling the beads. This would make a great gift idea for someone crafty.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024

reviewTitle: Super fun, amazing quality, just buy it!
reviewDescription: Love it! Accidentally bought the minis instead of the regular size but that was a blessing in disguise as it had the exact dark green I needed to make my projects! So the variety is awesome. The board warps slightly when ironing but it’s still very usable afterwards. All my projects came out beautifully and they definitely are made to last. I really hope the seller makes it available to purchase one color of beads as I’m running out of black, white and dark green! Awesome product though, it’s truly helped put my hopes and dreams into reality, don’t think twice and buy it! Not only is it fun to do, but it’s awesome for concentration since the beads are so small and intricate. That said, definitely don’t buy the mini beads for kids😂 they might eat them.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2025

reviewTitle: These teeny tiny beads are a blast!
reviewDescription: I love these so much! Great selection of colors. For mini-bead pattern generation, use a 10 square per inch graph paper. Thought this was a great quality set for someone starting out with mini beads!

reviewTitle: Excellent at melting, poor grid construction
reviewDescription: I would take away half a star just for the plastic grids. I ironed my beads and the grids warped which was a bummer, but I am very impressed with the set overall. They were super easy to use, they were uniform in size and they melted so well. Also just a great selection of colors. I’d say these melted better than the 5mm perler brand beads (of course size alone could be the difference) but I was super happy with the way these turned out. I’d buy again but I’d be careful to use the tape method next time. The grids just can’t stand the heat.

reviewTitle: Happy accident: Be aware of the size
reviewDescription: I have purchased this multiple times. My kids love them. One note for people new to using these beads: these are smaller than the standard beads. The first time I ordered it, I didn’t know the difference. Upon realizing my mistake, we tried some of the tradition size. It turned out to be a happy mistake because my kids actually prefer these. (Note: my kids are 14, 19, and 21. They do say these are more challenging, so I’m not sure they would be the best choice for younger crafters. However, the end product is much more detailed with these smaller beads.)
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2025

reviewDescription: For the price this kit is great, the colors are seperated so it’s no hassle and it comes with everything you need. 10/10

reviewDescription: Lives the variety of colors. It provided many hours of fun for my granddaughter and me. I’ve included a picture of a few of the items we made.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2025

reviewTitle: Lots of colors and the tweezers are great!
reviewDescription: I love how small they are and there's enough colors to make anything you want! I made a piplup and an oshawatt pixel art so far! Another great thing about this pack it the tweezers that it comes with, I've used them in disassembling small electronics and other tasks, very durable!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2025

reviewTitle: So many colors and designs for hours of fun!
reviewDescription: This fuse bead kit is awesome! I got this kit as a shared Christmas gift for my 7 and 10 year old. They both have used kits like this at afterschool programs and at friends’ houses, but were really pumped to have their own set. The colors are vibrant and there are so many in the kit the kids will be able to make a ton of things. I also like that there are multiple pegboards with so many templates to choose from to have a guide on making things, but of course the kids can use their imagination to craft whatever they want. The case is prefect, keeping the colors separated, and making it easy to store or travel with. This craft kit is worth it!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2026

reviewTitle: Surprisingly Relaxing and Way More Fun Than I Expected
reviewDescription: Yes, this was absolutely for me. Sometimes I just want a break from diamond painting and these are perfect for switching things up. The set is really nice. Tons of beads in a great range of colors, and everything you need is included. The pegboards are sturdy, the tweezers work well, and having multiple ironing papers is handy. The beads melt evenly and hold their shape nicely once fused. It’s oddly relaxing and scratches that same creative itch without being the same activity every time. Easy to pick up, easy to put down, and very satisfying when a piece is finished. If you like crafty projects but want a change of pace now and then, this is a great set to have around.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2025

reviewTitle: Variety of colors. No need to sort colors.
reviewDescription: Fuse beads are colorful and come assorted in a easy to use covered box. The plastic clear bead trays are thin and a few broke in the package during shipping.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2025

reviewTitle: Huge craft kit that keeps kids busy
reviewDescription: Tons of colors and pieces with plenty of extras to create big designs. Great value for creative kids, though sorting takes time. High qulity and hours of fun for the kids!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2025

reviewDescription: We have been seeking additional fuse beads (Perler beads) for our home because our teenage daughter enjoys making crafts with them. To me, these items last a while because they don't take up much space and they are plastic, so they'll essentially last forever! Kidding aside, these massively comprehensive kit (11,000!!! beads) is just right for your kit, or as a starter kit for the whole shebang. A great gift that will provide hours of screen-free entertainment.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2025

reviewDescription: I like that there are a ton of colors in this set that you do not always find in other fuse bead sets. I like that they are already divided out by color is very helpful while designing. I appreciate that this comes not only with trays but also some designs that are nice for a variety of ages. The price for this set seems pretty good in comparison to other sets, especially when the variety of colors is a nice change from the typical. The peg backs are nice that the squares are interlocking.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2025

reviewDescription: This ARTKAL fuse bead kit is impressive. It comes with two tweezers, a HUGE plus so one kid doesn’t “get” them and the other not, a large sheet for ironing, loads of cool designs, 36 organized colors, and five pegboards. The packaging is also very giftable. These fuse beads are the normal size small ones. For ages five plus.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2025

reviewTitle: Everything you need at a great price!
reviewDescription: This is a great set to get started. It includes everything you need. They’ve also included an extra set of tweezers. There are several plates and different designs to get you started. You can look online and find free designs as well. These were a great value and for $10 more you can double the amount of beads by getting a 72 piece set. It’s a really good variety of colors. As an adult join in with your kiddos, creating different design designs. It’s lots of fun and this kit makes it easy to get started with everything you need
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2025

reviewDescription: I'm loving this Artkal fuse bead starter kit! As a fan of the brand, I appreciate the quality and ease of use. The larger beads are perfect for beginners, and the kit comes with everything you need to get started, including pegboards, a tweezer, iron paper, and plenty of design options. With over 36 colors to choose from, the creative possibilities are endless. I also have purchased the artkal craft iron separately but alternative irons will do to seal your design.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2025
